intro: Iozoste confertiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered iozoste, is a flowering plant characterized by its compact growth habit and clustered inflorescences. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes aromatic herbs and some toxic species. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in dense umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a finely toothed margin, and emit a mild, spicy aroma. Iozoste confertiflora is native to certain regions of South America and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
